author: Ilovebennjerry
title: Not enough brownies!
text:
Super good, don't get me wrong. But I came for the caramel and brownies, not the sweet cream. The packaging made it seem like brownies were packed and bountiful *crying frowny emoji* I'd say the taste of this was amazing, but the ratio of brownie to sweet cream was disappointing. Liked it regardless but probably won't buy again simply because it didn't live up to its promising package. I'll find another one that has a better ratio and wayyy more yummy chewy brownies.
Overall, good flavor, texture, idea, and brownies. Not so great caramel/sweet cream/ brownie RATIO. Just add more brownies. Please.
keywords_2: caramel,brownies,sweet cream,packaging,taste,ratio,yummy,texture,idea,caramel,sweet cream,brownie ratio

author: Sweettooth909
title: I’m OBSESSED with this pint!
text: I decided to try it out although I’m not a huge caramel fan, and the first buy was ok, didn’t like the caramel too much and for some reason that specific pint barely had any brownies! Like there were some on top but from the middle to the bottom? Zilch. Nada. Nothing! It was disappointing. But for some reason, I bought it again and I really do believe it was just that point bcuz the second one was glorious!! I had a big brownie chunk in EVERY bite. Plus the caramel didn’t bother me as much and I took a liking to it. Conclusion: I’m on my fifth pint, of the week and I’m going back to get my daily pint cus I’m kinda sick and need some happiness.
keywords_2: caramel, brownies, pint, disappoint, brownie chunk, fifth pint, daily pint, happiness

author: LaTanga71
title: My favorite...More Caramel Please
text: My caramel core begins to disappear about half way through. I only buy this for the caramel core. The first time I purchased this I was not even aware that there were blonde bits in there. You had me a salted caramel core, well this is the fourth pint that I have purchased and the caramel is plentiful at the top then it begins to get sparse about half way down at 3/4s of the way down its gone. It works out in my husbands favor because he doesn't care for the caramel so he gets to finish my pint while having a full pint of his choice. Please please please, its called salted caramel core for a reason. Let the caramel flow through the core. P.S. You could put a little extra in there, I totally would not mind.
keywords_2: salted caramel core, caramel, blonde bits, plentiful, sparse, flow

author: chicago220
title: Obsessed!!!
text: Why are people complaining about the blonde brownies? If you don’t like blonde brownies, get ice cream with fudge brownies! I LOVE the blonde brownies and cannot get enough of them. This ice cream is by far my favorite. I have driven to multiple stores to try and find it... and when I do, I stock up! I’ve tried other flavors when I can’t find this one, and none of them even come close to making me as happy as this does! I’d say sometimes the caramel to brownie ratio is a little off at times (more brownies please!), but I’ll still always enjoy it nevertheless!
keywords_2: Blonde Brownies , Ice Cream , Fudge Brownies , Caramel , Brownie Ratio , More Brownies , Enjoy

author: Kassidyk
title: Worst Ice Cream Ever!
text: This ice cream is worst ice cream I’ve ever tasted. I was beyond excited when I picked it up today and couldn’t wait to get home and try it. First the sweet cream ice cream has no flavour. But that’s fine I could get past that, but the salted caramel core is what’s really wrong. It’s disgusting and so salty it’s actually inedible. I’ve had ice cream before that I have really enjoyed but never to the point where I physically can not stomach it. I love salted caramel but this is just another level. I actually came here to read the reviews and see how others thought of it just in case mine was a bad batch. Never again!
keywords_2: ice cream , sweet cream , salted caramel , flavour, disgusting, salty, inedible, really enjoyed , bad batch , never again

author: Nikiera
title: Way Too Salty
text: I bought this last night to go with Louisiana Crunch cake because I was craving that salty and sweet flavor. Unfortunately, I was not thrilled with the salted caramel core of this ice cream. Usually, when you have salted caramel, the salt enhances the flavor of the caramel. The salt in this core OVERWHELMED everything, even the cake. It was disappointing to not enjoy my dessert and I doubt I'll be finishing this pint of ice cream, which is a shame because you should never have to throw away ice cream.
keywords_2: Salted caramel,Louisiana Crunch cake ,Salty,Sweet,Overwhelmed,Disappointing,Throw away ice cream

author: Mmelvin
title: Love this flavor, but...
text: This is definitely my favorite flavor, but recently, it does not have enough blonde brownie chunks. I'll go through at least half of the pint with just 1 or 2 chunks. It looks like plain ice cream with a salted caramel core. This has happened a lot lately, and it's so dissapointing. I've gotten to the point where I simply stopped buying it. Today, purchased two because they were on sale. It started the way it should be, with plenty of yummy chunks. Before I even got halfway as I was serving myself, no more chunks. After some digging around, I found 3 more way at the bottom. Please fix this! I love this ice cream, but it's pointless without the chunks.
keywords_2: Favorite flavor , Blonde Brownie chunks , Plain ice cream , Salted Caramel core , Disappointing , Stopped buying, Yummy chunks , Digging around , Fix this

author: Shay10
title: Really Wanted To Love This
text: I am not a chocolate person at all, and this was my very first time trying Ben & Jerry's, (Shame on me I'm 23 lol) so I was so excited to find a Caramel Ice Cream with BLONDE Brownie chunks instead of fudge. I really wanted to like this ice cream but I just couldn't. The Salted Caramel is a little too salty, In fact, I couldn't even eat the core, I just ate around it. I didn't really like the Sweet Cream Ice Cream, it didn't really have a taste to me, (Maybe Vanilla would be better). The only thing I loved about this Ice Cream were the Blonde Brownie Chunks, They were so delicious! I would love for this Ice Cream Recipe to be worked on, maybe I'll give it a try again in the future.
keywords_2: "Ben & Jerry's", "Caramel Ice Cream", "BLONDE Brownie", "Fudge", "Salted Caramel", "Sweet Cream Ice Cream", "Vanilla", "Blonde Brownie Chunks"

author: caramel4dayz
title: Could be better.
text: I LOVE caramel, so much so that I could eat it off a spoon, which was exactly what I was planning to do when I bought this ice cream. Unfortunately this caramel core is way too salty. I actually eat around it! I'm not a fan of the sweet cream ice cream flavor either; vanilla would've worked better. The blondie pieces were delicious but overall I'm disappointed. I really wanted to love this since I love Ben & Jerry's but this was not up to par with their other flavors!
keywords_2: caramel, spoon, salty, sweet cream, vanilla, blondie, Ben & Jerry's.

author: RosaT777
title: Salted Caramel core had NO CARAMEL
text: I love all the Ben & Jerry’s flavor. But recently I been so disappointed of my favorite flavor salted core caramel. It has no core
keywords_2: Ben & Jerry's , Flavor , Salted Core Caramel , Core

author: Realeyes
title: Caramel ended 1/2 way through
text: The ice cream really didn’t taste like anything significant and then the caramel which carried the whole dessert ended half way through the cup :( very disappointed!
keywords_2: Ice Cream, Caramel, Significant, Disappointment

author: Nicole V
title: Core went about an inch into the pint
text: The core was absolutely delicious for about a scoop of icecream. Then there was no core for the entire rest of the pint. Huge disappointment.
keywords_2: core, delicious, scoop, icecream, pint, disappointment

author: deva
title: good on top...not so good the further down you get
text: I've seen this flavor multiple times at the grocery store the past few months and been tempted, finally pulled the trigger last week.
keywords_2: flavor ,grocery store ,past few months ,pulled the trigger

title: Oh dear
text: I feel like a dork writing a review for ice cream, but usually a pint only lasts us 3-5 days in our home and we were so disappointed with this one and it's still in the freezer a month later untouched. In addition, I love anything caramel but the salted caramel core was so overbearing, I honestly don't know how this made it on to be a final flavor after the taste testers tried it. It's just too salty. We scooped the caramel into the sink, but then the rest was just a little boring. I will still be a loyal B&J fan, but will be super hesitant when it comes to their caramel line.
keywords_2: Ice cream ,Disappointed,Pint ,Salted caramel,Core ,Taste testers,Too salty ,Scooped,Boring,Loyal ,B&J ,Caramel line

author: BJBLU
title: Why aren’t the brownie bits chewy?
text: Hello. I just bought my 4th and 5th pints of salted caramel core while awaiting Hurricane Dorian to arrive. I will have to say that my son and I greatly enjoyed the first 3. Plenty of salty caramel (yum) and plenty of brownie bits that were chewy to the bite. However these last 2 pints that I just purchased do have plenty of caramel and brownie bits but they aren’t chewy. They are more crumbly to the bite. I’m not sure if the first 3 were a fluke or these last 2 weren’t right. Is the brownie supposed to be chewy or crumbly? These last 2 were disappointing for us and makes me question whether we should buy this kind again.
keywords_2: Chewy, Crumbly, Salted Caramel, Brownie bits, Hurricane Dorian, Buying, Fluke, Pint, Disappointing

author: Buffaloed
title: No Regrets!
text: So it's the middle of June and I made an impromptu decision to get a small thing of ice cream during my shopping trip. I initially was thinking of going for a strawberry or peach flavor, but then I saw this pint and had a double take. I'd never try this flavor prior and man, I do not regret it. I love this pint. I love sweet cream and blonde brownie so this was a win-win. I like how to salted caramel is in the center so I have the ability to control how much I want in each bite. I do agree that the salted caramel is a bit on the salty side, but like I said, I have the control to put as little as I want in my scoop.
keywords_2: Ice cream,Strawberry,Peach,Pint,Sweet cream,Blonde brownie,Salted caramel,Control

author: Calla
title: Perfection!
text: I'll be completely honest, I'm not generally a fan of caramel (it's just too sweet for me) but I gave this flavor a shot because of the sweet cream ice cream. As it turns out, the saltiness of the caramel core perfectly balances out the sweetness! I was pleasantly surprised by how much I enjoyed the salted caramel core. The blonde brownie chunks were also a nice touch and not too overwhelming. I feel like the ratio of mix ins to chunks was nicely balanced.
keywords_2: Salted Caramel Core ,Sweet Cream Ice Cream ,Blonde Brownie Chunks ,Ratio of Mix Ins to Chunks

author: April DD
title: Wow just wow
text: Okay I was expecting an almost too salty weirdly over sweet ice cream but man was I wrong!!! No seriously!!! I started eating this ice cream and was transported to the first time I had gooey caramel pop corn... the ice cream was like eating sweet corn creamy and smooth and the chewy bits supposed to be brownie tasted like caramel pop corn that had gotten chewy and sweet soaked in ice cream.. then the salty caramel center was too good to even say but together the best caramel pop corn ice cream I have ever had.. even though I don’t know if that’s what they were going for lol.. my favorite flavor so far
keywords_2: Ice cream, caramel popcorn, chewy brownie, salty caramel, caramel popcorn ice cream, favorite flavor

author: FuzzyGut
title: So good, but...
text: This was my 1st pint of Salted Caramel Core but not my first Ben and Jerry’s Core pint. My first impression was that my core was HUGE! It was literally overflowing when I opened the pint! Wow! And the caramel itself was delicious; salty sweet and gooey! The sweet cream ice cream was very rich and cut through the sweet of the core nicely. My only issue was the blonde brownie bits. It’s not that they weren’t plentiful, I just really didn’t like the taste of them, which is sad because the rest of the pint was KILLER! The chocolate brownies in the other flavors are amazingly good so I was disappointed that these blonde ones weren’t very good and I ate around them. So, all in all, it was a good pint with amazing caramel, good ice cream and funky brownies.
keywords_2: Salted Caramel Core, Ben and Jerry's Core Pint, Caramel, Sweet Cream Ice Cream, Blonde Brownie Bits, Chocolate Brownies

author: SaltedCaramelLover
title: Favorite Flavor!
text:
This is my all time favorite flavor. For me it's the perfect combination of sweet and salty and its upsetting to see so many people hate on it. I think vanilla would be too over powering but everyone's taste buds are different. I do agree the blonde brownie bits have been lacking... but I'm an eat the entire pint kinda gal.. oops..sit down to a good movie and this is my go to snack to grab (wish it came in a dairy free option, but I live in WI so I suffer through being lactose intolerant all the time)
So in short, it is sweet and salty flavor. I always have a partial scoop of ice cream to core spoonful I eat and I guess I'm the weirdo that runs outta caramel before ice cream... oops xD
keywords_2: Sweet, Salty, Vanilla, Blonde Brownie Bits, Dairy Free Option, Caramel, Ice Cream

author: jordan3896
title: Too much
text: I love carmel so much and as soon as I saw carmel core I grabbed it off the shelf. The carmel tastes great and I love the ice cream and blonde brownie pieces in it!!! The only thing that is wrong with it is how much carmel they gave me. It was 3/4 carmel and 1/4 ice cream. It wasn’t a good balance and I probably won’t get it again.
keywords_2: carmel, ice cream, blonde brownie pieces, 3,4 carmel, 1,4 ice cream, balance, won't get it again

author: CollegeGal
title: My Favorite Flavor- One of a Kind
text: I always wanted a flavor of ice cream that was tailored to the way my taste buds worked. Most ice cream flavors from other companies that have cookie dough in it is chocolate based, but Ben & Jerry’s has cornered the market: this cookie dough is caramel and butter and cookie based (or blondie if that’s the correct term)! I’ve been buying it almost every weekend at college for a year! Please keep this flavor, it makes me so happy. The fact that there’s a cookie dough flavor that is chocolate free is one of a kind and not many ice companies make that!
keywords_2: Ice Cream ,Ben & Jerry's ,Cookie Dough ,Caramel ,Butter ,Blondie ,Chocolate ,College ,Weekend

author: Margot
title: Core more like pencil line
text: I was so excited to try the “core” pints. The picture they show online makes it look like a decent size and width. The reality: the core of my salted caramel pint was the width of a pencil eraser tip. Incredibly disappointing and 100% not as advertised. I feel duped.
keywords_2: "Core" "picure" "online" "sized width" "salted caramel" "pint" "width of pencil eraser tip" "disappointing" "not as advertised" "duped"

author: ne26
title: Core-full?
text: I bought this on sale and was excited to try it. While the ice cream is light and blondies are a nice treat, I wish there was more of a salted caramel core. Mine did not go down even halfway, which is a pity because I love salted caramel.
keywords_2: Ice Cream ,Blondies ,Salted Caramel ,Sale,Core

author: Rileyhd
title: Not terrible
text: I had to buy this to since they were all out of mint at the store...lots of Carmel Core which was a plus but no blondie chunks!!! Any were so tiny...very disappointed because Ben and jerrys rocks!!
keywords_2: buy, mint, Carmel Core, blondie chunks, tiny, Ben & Jerry's

author: Pasz
title: Why
text: I love this but where did my core go??????????????
keywords_2: love, core

author: TimR
title: Salty Caramel?
text: I know sweet cream ice cream probably wouldn't be a big seller but I wish B&J would make more flavors with a sweet cream base or just a plain sweet cream ice cream. When the flavor was 1st introduced I used to get this regularly but it got to a point I was throwing away most of the caramel because it was too salty. I will still occasionally purchase as there are no other flavors with sweet cream.
keywords_2: Sweet cream,Ice cream,B&J,Flavor,Caramel,Salty

author: Cranky Yankee
title: Too salty
text: Bought this recently because my local target has stopped carrying Blondie Ambition, which was my favorite. I love the sweet-cream ice cream; my container didn't seem to have very many blondie chunks (which was disappointing, see previous) and the salted caramel core was overly salty. It was okay. I might buy it again but would rather have Blondie Ambition.
keywords_2: Ice Cream ,Blondie Ambition ,Blondie Chunks ,Sweet Cream ,Salted Caramel Core ,Target ,Local Target ,Okay ,Buy Again

author: karen511
title: Ok..
text: I really wanted to like this flavor but it was quite disappointing. Halfway into the pint, the core pretty much disappeared. There was way too much at the top and it wasn't dispersed evenly throughout the ice cream. The caramel was also way too salty for my tastes. Also wished there were more brownie pieces, only found a few in the entire pint.
keywords_2: flavor, disappointing, core, way too much, not dispersed evenly, caramel too salty, more brownie pieces

author: drewmar
title: Blonde brownies??
text: Couldn't find any in my pint. But the rest is fabulous, don't change a thing!

author: Tornado7
title: So disappointed!

It was too salty and there were barely any brownie chunks :/ I'm really sad this ice cream is going to go waste, but I'm not happy with my purchase at all.

author: Sunrise
title: Blondie Crumbs
text: Just bought this last night and like some of the other reviews there were only a few flecks of blondie. Mine was nothing like the photos. author: JandM
title: So Disappointed :(
text: I never thought I would not like a Ben & Jerry's flavor, but it's happened :( When my store didn't have my favorite flavor, I thought I would try the Salted Caramel Core - the description sounded great. Unfortunately, the caramel was *way* too salty - I ended up scooping it all out. The vanilla ice cream was good, but the brownie pieces had no flavor. I've never been disappointed by Ben & Jerry's before, but I guess there's a first for everything :(
keywords_2: Ben & Jerry’s , Salted Caramel Core , Vanilla Ice Cream , Brownie Pieces , Disappointing

author: ASaltyFan
title: They sure meant it when it said salted
text: The salted caramel core tastes like someone went a little too salt happy. There was just too much core in ratio with the ice cream an in addition to the bad core to ice cream ratio, the core was just too salty to handle. Please fix the core because the ice cream itself with the blonde brownie bits are delicious.
keywords_2: Salted caramel , Ice cream , Blonde brownie bits , Too salty , Bad core to ice cream ratio

author: elephantsforever3
title: Horrible pint, bland brownies
text: I was excited for this ice cream because I love blondies and caramel, but it was the one flavor I've tried that I strongly dislike. The core didn't go deep at all and it was SO salty that it made me feel kind of sick. The brownies were dry and sparce and I barely could taste them. The base was alright, I guess. Really dissapointed. I think this flavor needs to be fixed or just stopped being made.
keywords_2: Ice cream, Blondies, Caramel, Core, Salty, Brownies, Dry, Sparce, Base, Dissapointed, Fixed, Stopped

author: Rudy58
title: Best B&J Pint ever!
text: I've been hooked on this flavor for more than 2 weeks now. I wish I'd have known about it sooner lol! The Salted Caramel Core is very good and the Blonde Brownies make this product over the top. I do have one complaint though. I buy maybe 4 pints or more a week and everytime I open one and start eating them they are all different as far as how many brownie peices there are or the caramel. Sometimes there's a ton of salted caramel at the top which can be overwhelming and then it's gone half way down. Other times it's normal until you get about halfway and there nothing but the sweet cream ice cream with no caramel or brownies. It's always different, however I'm still in love with this flavor and I highly recommend it! Please B&J see if y'all can get them all the same lol

I always wanted a flavor of ice cream that was taylored to the way my taste buds worked. title: Too salty
text: The blondie mix ins and sweet cream ice cream were nice, but I really wasn't a fan of the caramel core, because it was far too salty. author: jessiraes
title: Good in theory...
text: I usually love salted caramel foods, and I adore Ben & Jerry's decadent ice creams. The ice cream was excellent, the brownie pieces were yummy, but the caramel tasted way too salty! The salt is supposed to compliment the caramel, not overpower it. I'm pretty disappointed.

author: Linda895
title: Too salty
text: I love anything caramel. I was super excited when I saw the whole core was salted caramel. However it was way too salty, I even tried mixing it with the sweet cream ice cream and it was still too salty. It could also use more of the brownie, which was certainly delicious.

author: Aggs
title: My all time favorite ice cream!!!
text: I.JUST.LOVE this ice cream!!! if I eat ice cream, it must always be B&J salted caramel core! I think I'm addicted. I noticed that some pints don't have that much chunks but the vanilla ice cream itself is pretty yummy and honestly, I cannot stay mad for long haha! title: Absolutely fantastic

title: Way too salty

author: Margaret
title: Too salty

author: Ohlivia
title: I love it I love it.
text: Salted caramel core is in my top three. My eating tactic is to scoop the ice cream from the outside and then smash the back of the spoon into the core so when I take a bite the first thing I'm hit with is salty and then it's sweet.

author: Atsoli
title: Horrible!

title: Too Salty for my buds

author: Iceicecream430
title: Don’t buy this one!

author: Kaitie13
title: Where did the core go???
text:
So this used to be one of my favourite flavours! The Caramel is very salty and the blondie bits are very chewy but i love that!
The disappointment comes in the fact that the first few times i got this the core went right through to the very bottom! A thick gooey caramel all they way to the last bite. Each time I have gotten this since I have found the caramel to end sooner and sooner in the pint. This last container the caramel went about half way through .
Please bring back the core!!
keywords_2: Caramel ,Blondie Bits ,Gooey Caramel ,Thick Gooey Caramel ,Core

author: Sparky
title: Core is misleading
text: I enjoyed the of flavor of the ice cream. But I was expecting much more caramel. When the label reads "Salted Caramel Core", I expected the caramel to be from the top to the bottom. At least that's what I think of the core to be. Like an apple core, it's in the middle from top to bottom. The core is the center of things.

author: gilderoy

author: MikeA128
title: Used to love! Keyword’s “used to”
text: I found the salted caramel core shortly after discovering Karamel Sutra. Needless to say I fell in love! author: klyoliphant
title: Good ice cream, too salty
text: The sweet cream and blondie chunks were delicious, but the core was almost too salty to eat. The taste of salt was completely overpowering the caramel flavor. Good overall, just needs less salt.
keywords_2: sweet cream, blondie chunks, salt, caramel flavor, less salt

author: DeeMarieT
title: Too salty
text: The core just tastes like salt with no caramel flavour. The ice-cream was floury & the blonde brownie pieces had no taste. Worst flavour I’ve ever had. Very disappointed. :(
keywords_2: keywords: salt, caramel, floury, blonde brownie, taste, disappointed

author: Goodduncan
title: Love this-but need more
text:
I purchase this flavor A LOT. Probably too much honestly. I have lived this for a while. Recently the punts seem to be lacking be caramel core to the bottom of the pint and the blondies are missing. There’s like 2 spoons of the caramel and 3 pieces of blondie.
Like I said before, I live this flavor. I just hope the manufacturing can go back to when I first found this flavor and fell in love!
keywords_2: Flavor, Purchase, Caramel, Blondies, Manufacturing

author: GAPat
title: Meh!
text: The ice-cream is disappointingly tasteless...why not use vanilla. The caramel us too salty and intense...why not swirled? The brownie bites were few and far between.
keywords_2: ice-cream , vanilla, caramel , salty, intense, swirled , brownie bites

author: Jade_12
title: Brownies good, Caramel not so much
text: I love Ben and Jerrys! The brownies and ice cream were very good! The caramel was just overwhelmingly salty. I couldn't even eat it. Maybe it's just not for me. :(
keywords_2: Ben and Jerrys,brownies,ice cream,caramel,salty

author: Jmask
title: Very salty
text: I had looked forward to trying this flavor but found the core saltier than the ocean. As someone who loves caramel this is the worst caramel I have ever tried. I
keywords_2: Review, Flavor, Salty, Caramel, Worst

author: VJRaye
title: SALTY!!
text: Typically I love salted caramel desserts (or caramel in general), so when I saw this ice cream I was eager to try it. That caramel core nearly knocked me over with its saltiness!! For me, it overpowered the combined flavor of sweet cream, brownies and caramel. I agree with the other reviewers, vanilla ice cream might have been a better balance. However, I do like the blondies. So close!! :-(
keywords_2: Salted Caramel,Caramel,Ice Cream,Sweet Cream,Brownies,Vanilla Ice Cream,Blondies

author: Drew C
title: Almost Delicious
text: the flavors are great and they work well together. Unfortunately, they do not work well with the core concept. The caramel would be much better if it were evenly distributed throughout the ice cream, rather than isolated in one huge pool. The blondies could pack a bit more flavor as well. So far, I have yet to have a variety of Ben & Jerry's core flavors that would not taste better if the flavors were evenly distributed. They almost taste like a cheap Ben & Jerry's knockoff.
keywords_2: Flavors,Caramel ,Blondies ,Ben & Jerry's ,Core Concept ,Cheap Knockoff ,Evenly Distributed ,Pack Flavor

author: USAFVeteran87
title: Great but really salty in the caramel core...
text: I bought this favor couple of days ago and thought what could be bad about a salted caramel core. Everything was great except the core was so salty that it drowned out the other favors. I do mean salty the 180 mg are in the caramel core. It left a nasty taste in my mouth. Anybody who needs to watch there salt intake shouldn't eat this ice cream favor.
keywords_2: salted caramelcore180 mgsaltynasty tastewatch salt intake

author: Val3914
title: Salt core?
text: I bought this the other day and was so excited, but when I tried it, the core was way too salty. I love salted caramel, and all the other reviews rave about the core so I'm pretty confused.. Maybe I got a bad pint but it was like salt with an essence of caramel. Sooo overpoweringly salty; first time I've avoided a swirl or core :(
keywords_2: Salted caramel, Core, Overpoweringly salty, Swirl, Bad pint

author: Kmorrow14
title: Please never discontinue.
text: I don't even understand how anyone could have anything bad to say about this ice cream. The sweat cream base is just the right about of sweet. The salted caramel core is almost bitter on it's own but when paired together they are such a great couple, plus the blondie bites! I am a digger and I never run out of these delicious gems. I will cry If they discontinue this one. For someone that doesn't want an overly sweet ice cream this is perfect.
keywords_2: Ice cream, Sweet cream, Salted caramel, Bitter, Blondie bites, Delicious, Discontinue, Sweet

author: Frankrizzo609
title: Perfect combination!

author: vtmaple
title: Shaken to the Core
text: My husband was away for the evening, and I felt like a little R&R so I headed to the store for some trusty B&J. I decided to go for a flavor I'd never tried. The description sounded so delicious. And delicious it was! Until, I discovered the core was no more than a dollop on top. At about an inch deep it just vanished, leaving me with nothing but the ice cream and blondies... pretty good stuff, but I'm disappointed at the lack of core.
keywords_2: trusty B&J,ice cream,blondies,core,R&R

author: MELA
title: Too Salty

author: Nick
title: Great ice cream
text: This flavor is magnificent. The sweet cream ice cream works perfectly with the caramel and blondies. And the blondies are particularly great - soft and flavorful. I'm always scared that this flavor will go to the graveyard. Please, Ben and Jerry's, don't discontinue salted caramel core!
keywords_2: Salted Caramel Core , Sweet Cream Ice Cream , Caramel , Blondies , Ben and Jerry's , Graveyard , Discontinue

author: Shelby844
title: My parents by was disappointing

keywords_2: try something new,looked delicious,REALLY good,ice cream,blonde chi,caramel core,feel jipped

author: Laydgodiva
title: THEE BEST HANDS DOWN
text:
I LOVE this flavor!!!
I have been addicted to this since 2016!!!
It surpasses anything like it!
I love salted caramel ice cream. However it’s hard finding one WITHOUT chocolate!!!
Chocolate overwhelms the salted caramel for me!
However, salted caramel core gets it right!!!

keywords_2: love, addicted, 2016, salted caramel, ice cream, chocolate, blondie bites, don't discontinue, afford, purchase

author: Cami123
title: I wanted to like it...
text: I really wanted to like this ice cream because I'm a die hard B&J's fan! However it just wasn't that great. The ice cream base was very yummy, it wasn't an overpowering flavor and the blondie chucks were very good! But the center, tasted like pure table salt and sugar mixed. It really was over the top salts to the point where I just ended up eating around it...I wish I would have gotten another flavor if I had known.
keywords_2: Ice Cream ,B&J's ,Blondie Chucks ,Table Salt ,Sugar ,Flavor

author: Leeanette323
title: What happened to the blondes bites?
text: This was my favorite Ben and Jerry's flavor. I still love the sweet cream ice-cream and I adore the caramel core, but something happened to the blonde brownie pieces. They used to be soft and chewy, perfect texture and delicious. The texture has changed now they are hard and crumbly very disappointing. Thought it was a fluke but the last maybe 5 pints I've had from different stores have all had the same issue.
keywords_2: Ben and Jerry's, sweet cream, caramel core, blonde brownie, texture, crumbly, disappointing, 5 pints, different stores.

author: Alli
title: Delicious brownies but caramel is disgusting
text: I bought this last night and was very excited to try. Brownie was great but caramel was so salty that I couldn't even eat it. It was like someone poured a salt shaker's worth of salt into it. Did anyone else have this experience?
keywords_2: Brownie,Caramel,Salt,Salt shaker,Eating

author: kpay
title: SO GOOD.

keywords_2: Cry, Husband, Freezer, Vanilla Ice Cream, Sweet Cream, Salted Caramel Core, Blonde Brownie Chunks

author: katiejanes
title: THE BEST!
text: This is truly my favorite ice cream flavor! I have introduced several friends to it, and they love it just as much! author: Chickenleg
title: The best thing I’ve ever put in my mouth

author: ChrisColby
title: So simple, yet so effective.
text: Ben and Jerry's took the peanut butter/chocolate flavor and knocked it out the park yet again. The peanut butter ice cream is great as always, but combined with the pretzel swirls, the flavor is heightened to an amazing degree. A nice little crunch to the pretzels as well for texture. The brownies aren't quite as good as in other flavors but definitely plentiful and still tasty. Put em all together and you get a salty/sweet peanut butter and chocolate combination that just works. A great flavor.
keywords_2: Ben and Jerry's,Peanut Butter,Chocolate ,Pretzel Swirls,Brownies,Crunch,Salty,Sweet

author: wormmoons
title: THIS IS THE BEST ICE CREAM IVE EVER HAD
text: The actual peanut butter ice cream is amazing, the brownie chunks taste like they were just cooked. The pretzel bits are the most amazing thing I have eaten, they are not too salty. They are not crunchy or too soft, evert time I get a bite with the pretzel in it I have to just stop and savor it. So far I have only found these at Target I have shared about eight pints in a couple weeks with my husband. Honestly it's the best ice cream I've ever had. Hard, soft, homemade, vegan or non, it's the best.
keywords_2: Peanut Butter, Brownie Chunks , Pretzel Bits, Target, Salty , Crunchy , Soft, Homemade , Vegan, Non , Best

author: bluejaysfan_1975
title: Love it!

I love the PB ice cream rather than another flavour with gobs of actual peanut butter* throughout the pint**. But...Everytime I look at the red couch on the label i can't help but think of tomatoes and thats not a flavour combo I wanna try anytime soon.*** Yuck!
* Don't get me wrong, I loves me some PB gobs but we got enough of those.
** I know that its not a pint here in Canada. But it sounds better than "2 cup tub o' B & J's"
*** If there IS a Tomato ice cream with chunks of marzipan and marshmallow swirl flavour in the works I'd beg you good folks to reconsider.

author: Carmalina
title: New Favorite for Ice Cream Addict
text: I bought a pint of this when it first came out and I ate the whole thing in one sitting. And another the next day. The pretzels are almost more like sprinkles of salt with a bit of texture, the fudge brownie is dark and rich enough to break up any monotony. I don't want this to ever go away (even if it's responsible for 90% of my quarentine weight gain) :P

author: Sydsscoops
title: Great concept that needs some tweaking in the lab
text: I wanted to love this flavor. What’s not to like? Peanut butter ice cream with pretzel swirls and brownie pieces—should be a hit. It is not. First, the peanut butter ice cream is WAY too salty. I agree some salt is needed to offset what could otherwise be a cloyingly sweet peanut butter flavor, but this kills any semblance of peanut butter flavor and is unnecessary given the pretzel swirls. Second, why pretzel swirls and not pieces or chunks? The swirls are weirdly soft and barely evoke the sense of eating a pretzel. Finally, the brownie chunks were just weird. They are the same ones as in Half Baked, where they work beautifully. Here, I respect the need to bring in a chocolate component with a peanut butter base, that’s a no-brainer. But why not go with fudge chunks or chips? The brownies brought no flavor to this pint and certainly did not help on texture. A slight re-tooling of the flavors and components would probably make this the ice cream dream the description promised.
keywords_2: keywords: peanut butter, pretzel, swirls, brownie, salty, sweet, Half Baked, fudge, chips, texture, description, dream

author: chelsealovesicecream
title: BEST flavor EVER
text: During quarantine I was living off of Half Baked...but when I went to the store all that was left was Chip Happens. Having been heartbroken by another brand's "Milkshake and Fries" I reluctantly bought Chip Happens. I am happy to report Ben & Jerry's NAILED this flavor. The lighter chocolate, chocolate chunks and the perfectly CRUNCHY salty potato chip swirl is EXACTLY what every sweet/salty craving is made of. I put on my quarantine mask and went back to the store and bought the 4 pints left. I need another freezer to stock this flavor. Hope it remains a regular flavor because it says "limited botched edition". Break quarantine and RUN to get Chip Happens!
keywords_2: quarantine, Half Baked, Chip Happens, Ben & Jerry's, chocolate, chocolate chunks, salty, potato chip, swirl, sweet, craving, freezer, limited botched edition

author: horix
title: Please, never get rid of this potato chip flavor!
text: My favorite flavor used to be Late Night Snack because of the amazing innovation of the salty potato chip balls they used in combination with the sweet ice cream. The combo is heavenly. I've been waiting for years for Ben and Jerry's to bring back the potato chip ingredient and lo and behold yesterday at the store I found this flavor. It's even better than I remember late night snack being; the potato chip swirl provides a perfect salty and sweet combo in almost every bite. Please make this a permanent flavor; or at least release something else that uses this potato chip ingredient because I'll be SO sad if I have to wait years for it to appear again.
keywords_2: Ben & Jerry's, Late Night Snack, Potato Chip, Salty, Sweet Ice Cream, Potato Chip Swirl, Permanent Flavor

Thank you!!!
keywords_2: keywords: permanent flavor, LOVE, peanut butter and jelly, chocolate ice cream, chips, limited batch

title: Love this flavor combo!

author: chipalwayshappens
title: Best B&J's flavor!
text: I am a lover of all things sweet and salty, so when I saw this in my grocery freezer I just knew I had to try it. Ben & Jerry's did NOT disappoint with this flavor! I've searched for and bought this flavor countless times since I first found it a few months back, and I enjoy it a little more each time. The sweet & salty balance in this one is perfect. The only downside I can say is that the consistency of the potato chips are often in botches and not evenly distributed throughout, but that's nothing some scoop controlling can't fix. Please keep this one permanently!
keywords_2: Ben & Jerry's , Sweet & Salty , Grocery Freezer, Potato Chips, Consistency, Scoop Controlling

author: MJamz
title: Chip Chip Hooray!
text: Fresh off the taste test, I'd say this was a great addition to the flavor line-up! It's simple but different enough from the usual B&J's components (although those are great too!). I appreciate that the base is a bit of a lighter, milkier chocolate-- more like in Chocolate Shake It than Fudge Brownie. The potato chip swirl is fantastically crunchy and salty. I'd love a real mish-mosh with a split between chocolate and vanilla (or peanut butter), and BOTH the chip and pretzel swirl (like in Glampfire Trail Mix)... what botch heaven that would be.

author: lizziea
title: If you get rid of this, I will cry.
text:
This is the best ice cream flavor ever. I'm someone who gets fries and dips them in a chocolate shake, and this ice cream is like that but with less mess, more texture, and more flavor. I love the sweet and salty combo, and I feel that the addition of the chocolate chunks are really what make this ice cream so unbelievably fantastic. And the chips -- they're in a swirl, they stay crunchy, and there's the perfect amount! The combination of textures and flavors is just amazing.
My only complaint is that this is a limited botch. Like the title of this review says, there will be tears from me if you get rid of this. This NEEDS to be a regular flavor, and I really hope this opens up the door for more sweet and salty flavors. Please don't get rid of this flavor! If you do, I will hoard as many pints as possible and eat them for years.

author: audrey the icecream lover
title: MY FAVORITEST ICE CREAM EVAARRRRRRRR
text:
Dearest Ben and Jerry,
Chip Happens is the most divine ice cream flavor to ever grace this earth. Honestly, the way the potato chips looked on the packaging looked a little suspicious. BUT, I was BLOWN AWAY WHEN I TASTED THIS MASTERPIECE OF A FROZEN DESSERT. I LOVE IT SO MUCH. it is the PERFECT combination of sweet and salty. And just REALLY GOOD. In fact, I recommended it to a friend, who once said his favorite flavor was mint chip. BUT ONCE HE TASTED HE THE HEAVENLY TASTE OF CHIP HAPPENS, HE WAS converted as well. We ate so much ice cream for two weeks and put hot fudge on it. It was really a beautiful experience. I will forever hold these memories close to my heart. A month later, I returned to the grocery store scouring the shelves for my beloved ice cream. And to my horror, I could not find it. I even had a whole conversation with a lady at the grocery store employee about how distraught i was. I returned home, sad, hungry, and heartbroken, for my beloved ice cream had left. But, I will not rest until i can experience this ice cream flavor once more. I am calling on you Ben and Jerry, BRING BACK THIS ICE CREAM FLAVOR. IT IS SO MUCH BETTER THAN YOUR STANDARD FLAVORS AND DESERVES TO BE RECOGNIZED FOR THE BEAUTEOUS FOOD ITEM IT IS. I WISH FOR NOTHING MORE THAN TO TASTE THE SWEET GOODNESS OF CHIP HAPPENS.
Love,
Audrey
keywords_2: Chip Happens,sweet and salty,mint chip,hot fudge,ice cream flavor,Ben and Jerry,beauteous food item,sweet goodness

author: Doglover88888888
title: OMG!!!!!! SOOOOOOO DELICIOUS!!!!!
text: Am trying this flavor for the first time right now. Took my first bite and fell in love IMMEDIATELY!! May just be my new favorite flavor!! Have tried a different brand of mascarpone ice cream before and it basically just tasted like vanilla. This is the complete opposite!! Definitely not just plain old boring vanilla!! Can NOT believe how amazingly delicious this is!! Everyone needs to try this now!! Would probably drive 10 hours to get this if i had to like omg it's just that good!!!!!!!!!! Please ben and jerry's-I'm literally begging you to keep this flavor FOREVER!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
keywords_2: Ben & Jerry's,Mascarpone,ice cream,flavor ,vanilla,delicious,begging,keep forever

author: Plumber
title: LOVE THE SWIRL
text: I love this flavor. It’s light but packs a POWERFUL flavor punch. And the swirl is kind of hidden by its color but man if you find a big pocket of it and try and isolate it, it’s the BEST. The chocolate covered pastry things have Always been crunchy in my 20+ pints to date. The flavor is just so boom in your face. The texture of the Mars alone swirl is insane. This is my 2nd favorite flavor behind Gimme Smore. So help me god if you guys discontinue this flavor or gimme smore, I will come down on you with the wrath of a thousand lightning bolts. Haha. Plz make a cake batter with chocolate chocolate chip swirl and a brownie batter something
keywords_2: flavor, powerful, swirl, chocolate covered pastry, crunchy, texture, Mars,Cake batter, chocolate chip swirl, brownie batter.

author: Arubaman68
title: My Prayers Have Been Answered!!
text: I was devastated when the “Holly Cannoli” flavor was discontinued years ago. Every time I passed the ice cream aisle in my supermarket, I’d search for the Cannoli flavor, hoping to see it again. Just when I was about to give up, THERE IT WAS!!!!! I scooped up every pint I could get my hands on. This flavor is the best!! The sweet marscapone cream and chocolatey shell pieces make for a sweet celebration for the tastebuds. Thank you so much for bringing this awesome flavor back! Please don’t ever discontinue it again. You’ve struck gold with this flavor — it is truly is a treat!
keywords_2: Holly Cannoli, Marscapone Cream, Chocolatey Shell, Discontinued, Sweet Celebration, TasteBuds, Strike Gold, Treat

author: antaresoceana
title: I think this is my new 2nd favourite ice cream
text: Oh man. Where to begin. Two bites and I knew. The marscapone ice cream? Dude. The cannoli shells? DUDE. They're so crispy it's almost like magic how crispy they stay. And coated in chocolate nonetheless! The marscapone swirl is something you almost forget about too but like not even in a bad way because you end up stumbling upon it without expecting to do so and it HITS YOU IN THE FACE WITH DECADENT FLAOUR. Also the chocolate chips are the mini's, the cute ones. Perfectly sized!! B & J knocked it out of the park with this one. A+++
keywords_2: Marscapone Ice Cream,Cannoli Shells,Chocolate,Chocolate Chips,Decadent Flavour,Mini Chocolate Chips

author: Danilicious
title: Holy Cannoli!!!!
text: Bought this on my recent trip to Target. Had NO expectations...it just sounded interesting. To my surprise this flavor has quickly become my new fave! (Right under Half Baked) It seemed creamier than usual which I attribute to the marscapone. The cannoli pieces are delish and it is an overall pleasant experience. No clue why anyone would call it "plain" unless they were expecting the ice cream to be the flavor of the shell or something. If you are looking for something packed with flavor this one isn't for you. This flavor is meant to have when youre craving a more sophisticated dessert. Quick tip: let it sit out until its soft enough that you're not waging war between it and your spoon at every bite. Takes it to another level ;)
keywords_2: target, marscapone, cannoli, plain, sophisticated, war, spoon, level

author: Fallerina
title: Where’s the shell pieces?!
text: The flavor is great, but there were almost no pieces of the cannoli shell in the pint. My husband and I both thought it was strange, and maybe a bad batch because you can always count on the pints to be pretty full of all the good stuff listed in the description. But not this time. And I see from another review that maybe this isn’t a fluke after all. The cannoli shell is the best part of the dessert, so it shouldn’t be skimped.
keywords_2: flavor, cannoli shell, pint, husband, bad batch, description, fluke, best part, dessert, skimped

author: ChrisColby
title: Hopefully never discontinued again!
text: A delicious take on the classic Italian dessert, B&J's Cannoli is a winner. The base is described as a marscapone flavor. Now marscapone isn't typically used for Cannolis but instead ricotta. Marscapone is a cream cheese used for cakes and other desserts. While not quite fitting the theme of a Cannoli in that regard, B&J made the right choice for the sake of flavor. The base is absolutely like a heightened cheesecake. Almost as if their regular cheesecake flavor was mixed with the equally delicious buttery brown sugar one. It's fantastic. The swirl is the same flavor, so they blend together seamlessly for a full on sweet cream cheese taste. And the pastry pieces are the perfect contrast to the base. Crunchy and covered in chocolate, they remind me of the similar chocolate dipped waffle cone pieces from Americone Dream, and there are plenty in each pint. Whether it fits the theme or not, Cannoli is a great flavor that I hope stays as a mainline one for a long time.
keywords_2: Delicious, Classic Italian Dessert, Marscapone, Ricotta, Cheesecake, Buttery Brown Sugar, Sweet Cream Cheese, Chocolate, Crunchy, Pastry Pieces, Americone Dream, Cannoli

author: whatdeanerwastalkingabout
title: Bland and Disappointing
text: Finally found this and regret it. It doesn’t taste at all like a cannoli, the bits were sparse and again, tasteless, like eating little chucks of chocolate covered cardboard. Waste of money and calories; just eat a cannoli.
keywords_2: "cannoli" , "taste" , "waste" , "money" , "calories" , "chocolate" , "cardboard"

author: LacySeesRed
title: If you like cannolis, you won't like this
text:
Do yourself a favor and put this ice cream down, walk over to the bakery section of whatever store you're in and get an actual cannoli. This tastes like someone added a crap ton of powdered sugar to artificially flavored cheesecake ice cream and blended it with stale cannoli bits (these could also be bran flakes for all I can tell but I'll take their word for it.)
So if you want a cannoli, get a cannoli and if you want Ben and Jerry's get a more reliable and well made flavor, they have so much better to offer than this.
keywords_2: Ice cream, Bakery, Powdered Sugar, Artificial Flavor, Cheesecake, Cannoli, Bran Flakes, Ben & Jerry's

author: RealIceCreamLover
title: Doesn't taste like a cannoli.

author: Chicksluvrock
title: Smart way to make a Smore's flavor
text: I have several favorite B&J's flavors, but I decided to go outside of my usual and get this flavor. With the first bite you can definitely taste a hint of marshmallow-y flavor in the base ice cream. It's different than just plain vanilla. I think they did a great job capturing that flavor. The chocolate cookie swirl and graham swirl is smart and I think it's a unique way to add the classic flavor of a smore. And of course, you can't go wrong with fudge flakes! I am a total mix-in and swirl junkie, the more the better, and Ben & Jerry's never disappoints with that! Great job on this flavor! Overall a unique take on a novel summer treat!
keywords_2: B&J's ,flavors ,marshmallow-y ,vanilla ,chocolate cookie swirl ,graham swirl,fudge flakes ,mix-in ,swirl ,Ben & Jerry

author: KGibby
title: Way better than the OG S'mores!
text: I've had many pints of the Gimme S'more while it's been out and tonight I accidentally grabbed the original S'mores, with the chocolate ice cream. It was the most disappointing moment when I opened the pint to find chocolate ice cream instead of the typical golden ice cream I was used to with the Gimme S'more. Gimme S'more is the perfect representation of what a S'more is: mostly composed of perfectly toasted marshmallows, hint of chocolate, and a great trail of graham crackers. I will be so sad when this pint leaves the shelves. And I will never make the mistake of buying the OG S'mores pint again. Too much chocolate to represent a S'more.
keywords_2: S'mores , Gimme S'more , Chocolate Ice Cream , Marshmallows , Chocolate , Graham Crackers

text: I was having trouble finding my favorite flavor of B&J at the store, when I came accross this one that seemed to be an overhauled version of it. I really did not like this one.
keywords_2: Ben & Jerry's,ice cream,s'mores,toasted marshmallow flavor,chocolate cookies,soft fudge swirl,graham crackers ,disappointing ,flavor ,old version

author: ChrisColby
title: Not quite S'mores, but tasty nonetheless.
text: The new S'mores flavor is much better than the standard flavor from the company. Ben and Jerry's wisely made the decision to use a marshmallow base instead of chocolate, so it doesn't overpower the other components. The base tastes more like sweet cream than marshmallow but when combined with the fudge flakes and graham cracker, the result tastes very close to the real deal. My only complaints are that the chocolate cookie crumbs overpower what little graham cracker there is, losing the theme a little. And the fudge flakes are strangely limited. Still, the components all come together to provide a tasty flavor, and I hope this limited edition lasts as long as possible.
keywords_2: S'mores ,Marshmallow base,Sweet cream ,Fudge flakes,Graham cracker ,Chocolate cookie crumbs ,Limited edition

author: Gimmemoresmore

I'm so sad it's limited edition and hope it becomes permanent. It's perfectly simple and complex-I wouldn't change a thing. author: Bip407
title: Prefer original S’mores flavor
text: I feel like this is a just a sweet vanilla ice cream with a cookie swirl, like cookies and cream. There was no noticeable marshmallow flavor, and occasionally I could taste the graham cracker. I much prefer the chocolate based s’mores flavor which was rich chocolate, and a creamy marshmallow, with the perfect amount of crumbly graham cracker. Really, what do you remember about s’mores over the campfire? The melted Hershey chocolate and the gooey toasted marshmallow, followed by the crumbly graham cracker. This new flavor really doesn’t have any of that except the memory of the gritty graham cracker, which was really only there to hold onto the chocolate and marshmallow.
keywords_2: Vanilla, Cookie, Marshmallow, Graham Cracker, Chocolate, Melted Hershey, Gooey, Toasted, Gritty, Memory

author: nflamari9488
title: All I kept thinking was "oh man, oh man!"
text: I literally just bought this 20 minutes ago, put a little bit in a bowl, and decided I had to write the review. I agree with one reviewer where they said the marshmallow ice-cream doesn't really taste like marshmallow. However, I feel like that's a really difficult flavor to capture and the overall execution was very good. I totally tasted the graham cracker pieces and I LOVE the chocolate cookies BJ puts in their ice-cream. If I had to make a critique or suggestion, I would say maybe have more graham cracker swirls and/or flavor the ice-cream graham cracker and have marshmallow swirls with the cookie and graham crackers? I don't know though because I'm pretty overkill with my ice-cream. If it doesn't sound like I'm going to die it wouldn't be my first choice. All in all, I am so happy, I'm struggling to not get more, and I would be very sad if this never came back.
keywords_2: Marshmallow, Graham Cracker, Chocolate Cookies, Cookies, Ice-Cream, Swirls, Flavor

author: Drewbee
title: Gimme S'moreeee
text: Please bring this flavor back. I noticed one love came back again this year so ive been waiting to see this one too especially since I can't imagine a single person who tried this didn't love it. I saw one person in their review said they ate 3 pints a week. I ate a whole pint every single day the whole time it was available. Bought my grocery store out every time they restocked. I still have 3 or 4 a week but no other flavor compares to this one, not even my old favorite. This ice cream ruins all other ice creams.
keywords_2: flavor ,one love ,review ,3 pints ,a week ,whole pint ,every day ,grocery store ,restocked ,3 or 4 a week ,other flavor

author: Jenn01234
title: I have never been let down more
text: The original s'mores ice cream was a dream come true, it was by far my favorite Ben & Jerry's flavor and I even drove to Vermont to tour the facility and get a cone there. When I tried this replacement I had hope to be wowed but was left feeling nothing but disappointment. S'mores do not have cookies in them so I am not sure where that idea came from, and normally I would like cookies in my ice cream but if I am looking for the flavor profile of a s'more this ice cream just doesn't deliver.
keywords_2: Ben & Jerry's ,favorite flavor ,Vermont ,S'mores ,disappointment ,cookies ,ice cream ,flavor profile

author: Bkeller08
title: Why change a good thing?
text: My favorite flavor of Ben and Jerry’s is S’mores, which I have been a fan of since it was called Marsha Marsha Marshmallow but it is the HARDEST flavor to find! I saw Gimme S’more in my grocery and got so excited! But when I got home, I was disappointed. I thought my favorite part of S’mores was the graham cracker swirls which are also in this flavor, but it turns out, the Chocolate ice cream was more vital to the awesomeness of the flavor than I thought. The “toasted marshmallow” Ice cream just tastes like vanilla. While the add-ins are good, the ice cream part of this pint leaves something to be desired. I guess I’ll forever be on the hunt for my fave flavor “S’mores” because you can’t beat it! They shouldn’t have changed a good thing!
keywords_2: Ben and Jerry's, S'mores, Marsha Marsha Marshmallow, Gimme S'more, graham cracker swirls, Chocolate ice cream, toasted marshmallow, Ice cream, add-ins, pint, hunt, fave flavor

author: Savv
title: PLEASE BRING IT BACK
text: I need this flavor to return. This was my favorite flavor of ice cream ever and I would buy multiple pints of it out of fear that I would go to the store one day and the “limited batch” ice cream would be gone. My heart broke as I checked the Ben and Jerry’s section of the freezer and saw that there was no more and it wasn’t coming back. PLEASE bring this back even for just a month so I can buy every stores stock. I’m serious, every time I eat ice cream now I just feel like it isn’t the same as gimme s’mores. I still check the ice cream section at every store I go to and I will continue to do so till it comes back :(
keywords_2: Ice cream, favorite flavor, limited batch, Ben & Jerry's, Gimme S'mores

author: Cait5
title: Ok, but NOWHERE near as good as the original.
text: Don't get me wrong, it isn't bad. It's fine. But I'm docking it one star because it comes nowhere close to the original S'mores flavor--this strikes me as a disappointing remix. The ice cream itself tastes closer to sweet cream than toasted marshmallow, and it lacks enough chocolate to actually compare it to a s'more--chocolate is supposed to be a constant component of the dessert! While I prefer the original's chocolate base regardless; if this flavor had more chocolate chunks and a toasted marshmallow swirl like the original, it might be a lot better. But as it stands, OG S'mores is still my favorite ice cream flavor ever and this simply doesn't come anywhere close to it.
keywords_2: ice cream, s'mores, chocolate base, toasted marshmallow, chocolate chunks, disappointing remix, sweet cream, favorite flavor, OG S'mores

author: Sarahjo723
title: So glad they went back to the original recipe
text: I loved the 2014 version of Gimie S‘ more. I was so disappointment when the ice cream flavor was changed to chocolate. That being said, once they brought back the toasted marshmallow flavored ice cream, I was thrilled. I liked the chocolate cookies, but the ice cream felt more like cookies and cream than s’mores, so I just added my own crushed graham crackers. EVEN MORE RECENTLY I noticed they changed the recipe, again. This time it was perfected!! I no longer have to add my own graham crackers.
keywords_2: keywords: Gimme S', 2014, toasted marshmallow, chocolate, cookies, ice cream, cookies & cream, crushed graham crackers, changed recipe, perfected

author: Lare Bear
title: A solid pint. Great use of flavor choice.
text: I bought this flavor last week while making a trip to my local scoop shop. Let me just start out by saying that smores is a hard flavor to really nail flavor wise. I really enjoyed the marshmallow ice cream. Alot of companies usually go with chocolate as a base for Smores and I think that its usually overwhelming and distracting from the marshmallow. So the star of the flavor show was definitely on point. The grahms are great and are a great topping used in alot of flavors lately. Unfortunately tgis pint suffers from the same thing most smores flavored things do and it was ultimately too sweet in my opinion. I enjoyed this pint but theres too many more to try to stop here!
keywords_2: smores, marshmallow ice cream, chocolate, grahams, sweet, pint

author: Cassidy
title: Definitely missed the mark
text: S’mores is my favorite flavor EVER. So when I saw Gimme S’mores in my local grocery store I almost fell over I was so excited! However the excitement was short-lived because this is not s’mores. Not even the slightest bit. If I were blindfolded and tried this, I would never guess that it is s’mores flavor. The “marshmallow” ice cream is vanilla and there is no hint of graham cracker. The most overpowering part is the chocolate cookie swirl...which is not s’mores. Don’t get me wrong, the ice cream is good! If I were rating based on taste it would get 5 Stars. But I’m rating it based on how closely it captures the s’mores flavor. If I could give it a 0 I would because this is basically The Tonight Dough without the cookie dough and chocolate ice cream. So do yourself a favor and just get that because at least you have cookie dough.
keywords_2: S'mores, Gimme S'mores, Marshmallow, Vanilla, Graham Cracker, Chocolate, Cookie Swirl, Taste, Five Stars, Tonight Dough, Cookie Dough

author: Ateag
title: The Best and Most Missed
text: This was the best s'more flavored edible substance I have ever consumed. Every time I saw "Limited Batch" on the label, I dreaded the day that would be my last time seeing it on the shelves. Mercy shone upon me each time, though, as upon return to my home, all the dread melted away as I rejoiced and beheld Heaven's essence grace my mouth with the textured, creamy delight of Gimme S'more. Alas, the day finally encroached upon my innocent self that I would see in its stead, "One Love". I've since settled for Milk&Cookies which I know can never fill the void once occupied by the dessert of unmatched divinity. I dream that one day I'll once again taste the treasure graciously gifted to this unworthy world by the great Ben and Jerry.
keywords_2: Ben and Jerry, Gimme S'more, Limited Batch, One Love, Milk&Cookies, dessert, divinity, Heaven's essence, textured, creamy delight

author: Andy0418

author: Disappointed625

I have to say, it is not at all what I was hoping for. I am a marshmallow junkie and was hoping for toasted marshmallow flavor; instead, I felt like I was eating vanilla chocolate chip with some of those cake crunchies that you find in ice cream cakes. keywords_2: Ben & Jerry's, Gimme S'more, toasted marshmallow , vanilla , chocolate chip , cake crunchies , ice cream cakes

author: ash84
title: The real deal!
text: I have been a hard-core regular cookie dough ice cream only fan for YEARS, but this flavor caught my eye at the beginning of summer and I haven't been able to buy any other ice cream since! It's the amazing cookie swirl that almost convinced me that I could love the Tonight Dough flavor, despite my hatred for the nasty peanut butter dough. And the ever so creamy toasted marshmellow ice cream was a pleasant surprise! Even the graham cracker swirl blends in perfectly so you don't feel like you have random dry crumbs messing up the texture! It's the perfect combination that at times tastes like what an Oreo ice cream should taste like! I haven't had my go-to cookie dough ice cream in over 4 months and will be incredibly sad when this masterpiece goes away!
keywords_2: cookie dough, Tonight Dough, peanut butter, toasted marshmallow, graham cracker swirl, Oreo ice cream, creamy, Hard-core regular, amazing

author: Frog
title: Breaks my Heart this is Only Limited Batch
text: I like ice cream and I eat a fair amount of it but never have I had an ice cream that haunts my dreams like this one. This ice cream might actually be perfect. The toasted marshmallow base is excellent and not too sweet and the flakes of chocolate add the perfect crunch to the blend. I'm not a big chocolate ice cream fan and I think that making the base marshmallow allows all of the flavors to be appreciated as one instead of being overpowered by chocolate. However, by far my favorite part of this ice cream is the graham cracker fudge swirl. Holy moley! It has a fantastic texture and the taste leads me on a whirlwind adventure. I don't know what I have to do to make this more than just a limited batch but I will do it. Every time I go to the grocery store I hold my breath that it will still be there waiting for me, cool and delicious.
keywords_2: Ice Cream, Marshmallow, Chocolate, Crunch, Chocolate Ice Cream, Graham Cracker Fudge, Limited Batch, Grocery Store

author: mchardy
title: Give it a good ol' try
text: Upon first spoon, I was overwhelmed with the disappointment of too much chocolate. I assumed that it was just another foolhardy excuse of a s'mores flavored food that would be overpowered with chocolate. However, I persevered and did not give up. As I continued on in my journey, I was greatly impressed. The marshmallow portions in the ice cream were great. was it as up to par as my usual go to staple of the Tonight Dough? No, But it was good enough to wear I would purchase again if I needed something different in my life. It does get better. Do not give up on this flavor, you really just gotta commit. Not a total fail of the s'mores flavor, which tends to be a difficult one to portray, however not a total success. It is good, though maybe not a typical s'mores. I do not think it completely captures the essence of s'mores, however I think that it is decadent and delicious enough for me to purchase again.
keywords_2: Chocolate, S'mores, Marshmallow, Tonight Dough, Fail, Success, Decadent, Delicious

author: givejackiesmore
title: New favorite flavor!
text: I was very disappointed when I saw my boyfriend decided to buy this flavor instead of Milk & Cookies... to the point where I ate all the ice cream in my freezer before even thinking about opening this new pint. And boy oh boy was I so wrong - the combinations of flavors in this pint exceeded all expectations and Gimme S'more has now risen the ranks to my new favorite Ben & Jerry's flavor. Don't get me wrong, I will eat ANY flavor, but now when I go to stores, I specifically search for this one! The only thing that makes me sad is that most places don't carry this flavor as it must not be as popular, but when it's available, it's embarrassing how excited I get. Don't sleep on this flavor like I did... I've never written a review for any product I've ever bought in my 27 years of life, and am happy that this is my first. I'd give it 10 stars if I could!

author: BringBackGimmeSmores
title: This is the best they've ever made.
text:
I was on a strict diet and hadn't touched B&J for months. Saw this in the grocery store and didn't even hesitate to take two pints. I love s'mores and I hate chocolate ice cream. It turned out to be even better than my other favorite (Milk and Cookies, which is btw a fight to find in any store because it's bought out so quick).
This ice cream is so good (and also a limited batch) that I drove to every grocery store in the area and bought all of the pints available (about 10 pints were left) because they were ALL on closeout and they were going so fast that I didn't want to risk taking the time to go and get a basket when I found more that 2 in a freezer and just bare-armed carried all of them to the register before someone else could. This is not an insane, ice-cream obsessed town, its a normal town. These are normal people. This ice cream is RIDICULOUS its TOO GOOD. If they don't bring this back as a regularly stocked product I will consider it one of the greatest food related tragedies of my life.

author: foodie29
title: Very disappointing.
text: I couldn't find the traditional "S'mores" flavor at the grocery store so, as a smores fan, I bought this one instead. What a disappointment! I literally took one bite and made a face because I did not like the flavor. I dug around for a minute looking for a marshmallow swirl.... nope, it's not there. Just small bits of chocolate cookie. What? How is this a smores ice cream? The base ice cream tastes nothing like marshmallow and certainly doesn't have the wonderful marshmallow texture the old ice cream had. Couldn't find anything resembling graham cracker here either, unlike the old one. This is just.... cookies and cream. And a pretty dull cookies and cream at that. This is not only nothing like smores, it is a dull ice cream.
keywords_2: Smores, Grocery Store, Flavor, Disappointment, Marshmallow, Chocolate Cookie, Graham Cracker, Cookies and Cream, Dull, Ice Cream

author: ChrisColby
title: Peanut Butter makes everything better
text: A flavor I'm glad to see back after liking it before it was discontinued, PB Half Baked is even better than I remembered. There's not much to say if youve already had the standard half baked. It works very similarly except that the vanilla portion of the flavor is now replaced with peanut butter ice cream, and the chocolate chip cookie dough is instead peanut butter cookie dough. For such slight changes though, they do make a big difference. One thing I disliked in the original half baked was how weak the vanilla base was and how it was completely dominated by the chocolate. That's not the case here as the peanut butter taste to the ice cream is strong enough to balance out the chocolate, giving the classic combination we know and love. The balance is also matched perfectly with the mix ins. There are HUGE brownie squares in this flavor, tasting great as always, and combined with the numerous peanut butter cookie dough pieces, you're getting the chocolate/peanut butter taste in every bite. If you're a fan of that flavor combination, you can't go wrong with Peanut Butter Half Baked.
keywords_2: Review, Peanut Butter Half Baked, Vanilla, Chocolate, Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough, Peanut Butter Ice Cream, Brownie Squares, Peanut Butter Cookie Dough, Chocolate,Peanut Butter

author: JennyWoof
title: Berry good!
text: All time favorite flavor! The berry flavored swirls of ice cream are perfectly delicately, but distinctly, flavored. The natural pastel purple that comes from the blackberries is definitely an adorable plus! The mascarpone ice cream swirls have that heavenly cheesecake-y taste, which combines with the soft crumbly shortbread to create a tiramisu-esque experience... but instead of the rich notes coming from cinnamon it comes from the crunchy fudge-covered almonds. May I suggest renaming this flavor to "Chuck Berry Mascarpone" after Chuck Berry: one of the pioneers of rock'n'roll.
keywords_2: favorite, berry, flavor, swirls, ice cream, natural pastel purple, blackberries, mascarpone, cheesecake, soft crumbly shortbread, tiramisu, fudge-covered almonds, Chuck Berry, Mascarpone, rock'n

author: Lexi143
title: Seriously The Best Ice Cream Ever
text: This is without a doubt the best ice cream I have ever tried from Ben and Jerry's, and probably from anywhere at all! There is a B&J's scoop shop down the street from my apartment, one a couple miles away, and countless grocery stores in between. However, I constantly find myself driving out of the way to go to the only store in the area that I know stocks this flavor regularly. It is the perfect combination of flavors, and I have a really hard time keeping myself from going through the whole pint in one quick sitting. I will be absolutely devastated when this exclusive flavor is no longer available. Please keep it as a regular!!
keywords_2: Ben and Jerry's , Ice Cream , Scoop Shop , Exclusive Flavor , Combine Flavors , Pint , Regularly Available

author: Tr6nce
title: Excellent
text: A lot of recent flavors from Ben and Jerry's have left me disappointed but I saw this at Whole Foods and had to give it a go, because I'm like a Ben and Jerry's expert at this point. I thought it was going to be gross but I was pleasantly surprised by how all the flavors complimented each other. I left a few other people in the house have a small spoonful and they liked it as well. And to the person who said Strawberry Cheesecake is gone, you are wrong. That flavor is everywhere and never going away. Perhaps your store just stopped carrying it. It would be nice if they brought back the Blueberry Cheesecake flavor that was an exclusive at Walmart years ago. Anyway, Blackberry ice cream gets thumbs up from me!
keywords_2: Ben and Jerry's, Whole Foods, Strawberry Cheesecake, Blueberry Cheesecake, Walmart, Blackberry Ice Cream

author: duckeeduck
title: This needs to be a REGULAR flavor!
text: Happened upon this at the grocery store, and knew I needed to get it. I've been enjoying Jen & Jerry's for decades, and my favorites before this were Cherry Garcia, Apple Pie a la Mode (from years ago - I heard this one couldn't be added to the reg. menu because the price of apples fluctuates too much), Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough, then Half-Baked, and more recently Cinnamon Buns. This one combines SO MANY of my favorites: cinnamon, dough, chocolate, brownies ... and now SPICE. YAS. I LOVE spiced and spicy chocolate, and what has been created here with this special edition is just EVERYTHING. PLEASE keep *churning* this one out!!! ;D It is simply the BEST.
keywords_2: Jen & Jerry's, Cherry Garcia, Apple Pie a la Mode, Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough, Half-Baked, Cinnamon Buns, cinnamon, dough, chocolate, brownies, spice, spiced, spicy chocolate

author: Puppylove
title: Best Flavor! Please Add Permanently!’
text: I have been hooked on half baked for years now but this flavor changed everything! There’s just so much depth of flavor. I thought the spicy brownie would be too much but it’s very mild. I’d still prefer normal brownie but not by much. I love that the cinnamon ice cream and chocolate ice cream are two different ice creams swirled together. At first glance I thought it was going to be just chocolate ice cream with cinnamon flavor but I was wrong. Every bite is a unique balance of flavor that sends my tastebuds to heaven. I just wish it wasn’t a limited batch. I can’t go back to just half baked after this.
keywords_2: Half Baked, Spicy Brownie, Cinnamon Ice Cream, Chocolate Ice Cream, Unique Balance of Flavor, Limited Batch.

author: MJamz
title: Sooooo close!
text:
I really enjoyed this flavor--interesting, but not so far out there that I couldn't wrap my taste buds around it (I was a bit skeptical about the spice factor, but it was nice and mild). However, while the pint succeeded in taste, it fell short on execution (bad pun unintended, considering the name). The chocolate base was noticeably less dense than the cinnamon, and was riddled with tiny air bubbles. It still tasted great, but the creaminess was inconsistent, and likewise, there were plenty of dough gobs but only 3 big brownie chunks. Seems like Justice Remix'd just needed a a bit more balanced mixing.
For reference, my pint's info: UPC 076840036745, Date FEB0621BJ52, 5095 09:20 67834702)
keywords_2: flavor, spice, chocolate, cinnamon, creamy, dough, gobs, brownie, chunks, mixing, UPC, Date, 5095

author: CinnamonLover
title: Best Ice Cream so far!
text: I love cinnamon more than any other flavour in general (in cakes, bubble gum, tequilla, porridge ... - you see, ice cream is certainly no exception), so i was really excited to try the ben & jerry's cinnamon bun, when I saw that flavour for the first time some years ago. Unfortunately, when it comes to ice cream, I strongly prefer chocolate over vanilla or caramel as a base, so I the cinnamon bun flavour didn't blow my mind completelly. Just 1 hour ago I saw THIS new flavour at a gas station and coudn't resist. It's even better than I expected, because the spiciness harmonize so well with the cinnamon & chocolate (that I always love). So I highly recommend this ice cream flavour to anyone, who really loves cinnamon in general and chocolate ice cream.
keywords_2: Cinnamon, Ben & Jerry's, Vanilla, Caramel, Chocolate, Spiciness, Ice Cream, Bubble Gum, Tequila, Porridge, Gas Station

author: SciFiLover
title: The spicy fudge MWAH!
text: The Ben & Jerry's line of ice cream is some of the best I have ever tasted. When I spied this, the newest in the freezer at my local grocery I was intrigued. So I ponied up my cash and brought it home. As usual, I popped the top and took a taste. OMG! I was floored. This has to be added to the line-up as a permanent option.It is everything I did not expect it to be. The flavors burst in your mouth! The combination of cinnamon and chocolate, although seemingly odd, are perfect together. And the "topping on the cake" is the spicy fudge brownie. Love this new flavor.
keywords_2: Ben & Jerry's , Ice Cream , Cinnamon , Chocolate , Spicy Fudge Brownie, New Flavor , Delicious , Perfect Combination , Bursting Flavors

author: Simsima
title: Went back and bought every last pint
text: This flavor combination is out of this world with perfect balance of flavors, textures and ... that cinnamon spice is everything. i wanted to try this initially because I support the cause and I was curious about how the flavor combo would be - and now I’m here begging you to add this to the regular rotation of flavors even though I never write reviews. I just went and bought out my local stores stock. Please add this to the regular line up!
keywords_2: flavor combination, perfect balance, cinnamon spice, support the cause, flavor combo, write reviews, regular rotation, regular line up

author: Jcforever3
title: Pretty good flavor! Worth trying.
text: I saw this in the store and had to buy it as soon as I saw the words "spicy brownie." They weren't lying, the brownies have a really interesting kick! I can understand why it was too strong for some, but for me it made up for the lack of cinnamon promised in the ice cream and cinnamon bun dough (which basically was like their cookie dough in texture minus the chips). This is a flavor for people who like the classics but are bold enough to try out some more exotic ones. Overall, one of the most intriguing flavors I've had from Ben and Jerry's.
keywords_2: brownie, spicy, cinnamon, ice cream, cookie dough, chips, classic, exotic, Ben and Jerry's

author: ForTheLoveOfReMixd
title: If This is Discontinued....
text: I'm not sure I will ever love again! This is a fantasticly unusual combination that just hits every mark for me. I can usually ration out my pints over a couple weeks, but this flavor only lasts me two sittings! Anytime you need a break from the sugary cinnamon, the deep rich chocolate is there to smooth things over with a little spice and vice versa. I would definitely become a regular fanatic if this became a daily flavor (r.i.p. my diet)
keywords_2: love, unusual, combination, pints, flavor, sugary, cinnamon, chocolate, rich, spice, regular, fanatic, daily, flavor, diet

author: Adam
title: I LOVE this flavor
text: It's so good! The cinnamon seems to pervade the entire pint and the spicy brownie bits are so tasty and interesting! I don't think that Ben and Jerry's has another flavor with a spicy element and I don't think that they need another one if they were to just keep this one around, which is exactly what they should do! I am gonna be so sad when they take this one away. I get that its kind of a weird flavor but it seems like the people who like it, REALLY love it.
keywords_2: cinnamon, spicy, brownie bits, Ben & Jerry's, weird flavor, love it

author: damien702
title: Best new flavor yet
text: This flavor is exactly what I didn’t know I needed, the cinnamon ice cream and hint of heat from the brownies really make it something special. I hope Justice ReMix’d becomes a regular flavor, it’s one of the best in the Ben and Jerry’s lineup and I’d be so sad to see it go.
keywords_2: Justice ReMix'd,Cinnamon ice cream,Brownies,Hint of heat,Ben & Jerry's,Regular flavor

author: AmyT
title: Perfection!
